tweets.text: Today this issue has been on @BBCRadioStoke, @Sotlive, @bbcmtd, @ITVCentral and been spoken about in detail at the @HouseofCommons by @AaronBell4NUL.  @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA  @RedIndustries2. It's time to #stopthestink #capitoff.

tweets.text:
Next BHS Webinar: 

A Flood Hydrology Roadmap for the UK - Delivery Plan for the First 7-Years

Wednesday 24th March 1-2pm

Sign up here:  https://t.co/z6jLFC28g7

By: Rob Lamb, Hannah Cloke, Sean Longfield & Nick Reynard 

@JBATrust  @UniofReading @EnvAgency @UK_CEH @hancloke

A cracking day of searching for smelt, resulted in a further seven fish being tagged this afternoon. All fish were in fantastic condition with one weighing in at 5.5oz, one ounce shy of the British record. As per Sunday, lots of juv bass and two bonus thin-lipped mullet. ü•í https://t.co/U06Md9BiuE

The @EnvAgency‚Äôs 300 metre concrete dam paid for by a 400 acre sand and gravel pit at Coggeshall is ‚Äúby far the most environmentally damaging and least popular of all flood management options being considered‚Äù https://t.co/JoU1SX5h3m

@paulthoro9ood @EnvAgency no protection for 20% houses quoted #cost #benifit ratio #wrong #damthedam just EA just #blindfolded community lead solution actually better for #environment so disproportionate destruction @JamesAbbott2013 @guardian @JoBeavis @michaelst1001

@itvnews @pinkcastleprin1 Not just rotten egg smell, smells from human waste, infected materials, dressings, animal parts, human parts, any nightmare you can imagine is dumped meters from homes, schools, hospitals, care homes! Is this morally right @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency üò¢üò¢üò¢

@itvnews Hydrogen sulphide is what is causing the stink, it's a dangerous gas that can kill instantly in the right concentrations. We would have had massive readings from the most complained about weekend in @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids history but they forgot to turn the bloody monitors on.

We‚Äôve been making repairs to a #Flood embankment on the River #Aire at Eskamhorn Farm near #Rawcliffe, in the East Riding of #Yorkshire following damage caused by floods. This is part of our ¬£10m package of work to repair defences one year on from #StormCiara https://t.co/V46ZEPhKhs

243 documented violations in 2 years and not a single prosecution. And guess what? Yep, you got it.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/VvjLy78nDI

Really interesting comments on https://t.co/ehpBmj0t2v about the upcoming Terry Avenue closure. Nobody wants to oppose flood defences, but the way this has been leveraged by @CityofYork and @EnvAgencyYNE to evade proper mitigation is appalling https://t.co/7lFoQeJtHJ

200 trees planted @CroxtethHall by the new wetland. Many thanks to @merseyforest for donating them. Lots of nice comments from passers by üòä Reed planting tomorrow #nfm #ACCP @EnvAgencyNW @cpvolgroup https://t.co/ipjMtln6p9
I'm not sure about the legality but it seems bang out of order. Is this the Lune? @RSPBbirders @HeyshamObs @Mrsh123Pete https://t.co/P63xp3r5fd

The @EnvAgencyYNE  #SheafScreen in #Sheffield is coming along nicely.

Most of the major civils works are now complete and control panels installed, next steps are the debris grabs, electrical wiring, welfare provision and the final user testing. 

Due for completion mid 2021. https://t.co/w70e6NwrdI

Genuinely interesting & important 10 Minute Rule Bill being introduced by @AaronBell4NUL, could have significant impact on how the @EnvAgency enforce and take action in the future. @IainDale would be an interesting topic for a phone in as there's very little other news around! https://t.co/IyBDqE1snZ

Smell of sewage and cloudy water with brown debris in the canal downstream of Berkhamsted sewage treatment works, Bullbeggars Lane, and flowing into Bulbourne - apparently it has been like this for days. @EnvAgency @thameswater is sewage being released? #chalkstreams https://t.co/6LTNy1Am4r

urls.title: Northumberland river sets new course after bank breach
urls.description: The River Coquet in Northumberland has taken a new course after overtopping its banks during heavy rain last month.

tweets.text:
We've carried out fish rescues on the River Coquet near Rothbury after a bank breach during heavy rain last month. 

The river has now set a new course and we've moved more than 250 fish from the depleted channel into the new stretch. 

Read more here: https://t.co/rRIKK2nYgt https://t.co/lgxcdCfa0e

Working with @WestcountryRT and @NESouthWest we have removed Keybridge Weir on the De Lank River, a tributary of the R Camel in north Cornwall, opening up 3k of river for fish.  The weir had been a barrier to fish migration for more than 100 years. #partnership https://t.co/2V0thDWNzO

tweets.text:
We cannot fully address the climate emergency without taking into account its disproportionate impact on women and children.

This #IWD2021, @EmmaHowardBoyd, @pow_rebecca and @MarianSpain explain why it's so vital that women's voices are heard.

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/oUJ5jCI6wT

We have started installing steel sheet piles to strengthen flood defences along the River Witham at Dixon Street. 

This is part of the #Lincoln Flood Defence Programme which will reduce the risk of flooding. 

Sign up to our flood warnings: https://t.co/hquuoBJJ9d #jnbentley https://t.co/nXmvAQwUAE

The #GreenRecoveryChallengeFund is back. Another ¬£40m will be up for grabs as @HeritageFundUK seeks projects prioritising the #environment.
The scheme is funded by @DefraGovUK and co-led by NLHF @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @EnvAgency https://t.co/ScbfvWFhg8

@Feargal_Sharkey @RiverBulbourne @EnvAgency @thameswater I've just shown this post to my friend who lives on a houseboat in Berkhamsted. She said that it's a regular problem in this particular spot and that there are always dead fish floating on the surface. She'd like to report it but thinks no one will listen. Is she right?
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency We're having similar issues with the @EnvAgency.  Thousands of complaints and they do nothing. Sorry they installed monitoring equipment and forgot to turn it on.
@SophieHenRob @wouldforthetree @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @thameswater The EA are apparently sending an engineer to investigate, we'll see what they say.
@wouldforthetree @Feargal_Sharkey @RiverBulbourne @EnvAgency @thameswater Good point. She says that the @EnvAgency know about it and sometimes turn up to check on it but nothing seems to change.

urls.title: What to do if you spot any pollution | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: We have over 500 pollution incidents reported to us every year, costing between ¬£50 and ¬£50,000 each to resolve.

tweets.text: @SophieHenRob @Feargal_Sharkey @RiverBulbourne @EnvAgency @thameswater No. If you don't report a problem then the @EnvAgency  and @thameswater can go on pretending it doesn't exist. She should report it every time https://t.co/36D6BM7CRX

@RiverBulbourne @EnvAgency @thameswater So the Bulbourne (and Gade) now join the @riverchess, Misbourne, Hughenden Stream and Wye. Just the Ver, Hamble and Ewelme Brook left for a full house!  This is not how we should be treating these globally rare rivers. What chance do they have?

Pager alert 1647 today. Volunteer lifeboat crew tasked by @HMCoastguard to assist @MPSKingston with incident in river near Lower Ham Road. Both D class Lifeboats swiftly launched with thanks to Gemma @EnvAgency for swift lock transit. https://t.co/58O2y3JnN7
A chance to peek inside a 'house' packed with property flood resilience features... https://t.co/e3FtAm8Bh3
Cracking weather for a survey monitoring @EnvAgency assets in Selsey this week! #rollonsummer #river #survey @GeoMax_UK https://t.co/EvDHCxx0uJ

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency They do nothing...it widespread failure to record, failure to monitor, failure to regulate... @EnvAgencyMids should be rebranded the ‚ÄòEnvironment Failure‚Äô ... @StinkStopthe #stopthestink
